de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture

Class AbstractTouchEventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture.AbstractTouchEventHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<AbstractTouchEventHandler>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDragGestureEventHandler, AbstractDragTabsEventHandler

    public abstract class AbstractTouchEventHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<AbstractTouchEventHandler>
    An abstract base class for all event handlers, which can be managed by a TouchEventDispatcher in order to dispatch touch events to them.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static int MAX_PRIORITY
      The maximum priority of an event handler.

      The minimum priority of an event handler.

        protected static final int MAX_PRIORITY
        The maximum priority of an event handler.

        protected static final int MIN_PRIORITY
        The minimum priority of an event handler.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTouchEventHandler

        public AbstractTouchEventHandler(int priority,
                                 @NonNull
                                 TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                                 int dragThreshold)
        Creates a new handler, which can be managed by a TouchEventDispatcher in order to dispatch touch events to it.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority of the handler as an Integer value. The priority must be at least MIN_PRIORITY and at maximum MAX_PRIORITY
        tabSwitcher - The tab switcher, the event handler belongs to, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The tab switcher may not be null
        dragThreshold - The threshold of the drag helper, which is used to recognize drag gestures, in pixels as an Integer value The threshold must be at least 0

    • Method Detail

      • getTabSwitcher

        @NonNull
protected final TabSwitcher getTabSwitcher()
        Returns the tab switcher, the event handler belongs to.
        Returns:
        The tab switcher, the event handler belongs to, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The tab switcher may not be null

      • getVelocityTracker

        @Nullable
protected final android.view.VelocityTracker getVelocityTracker()
        The velocity tracker, which is used by the touch handler to measure the velocity of drag gestures.
        Returns:
        The velocity tracker, which is used by the touch handler to measure the velocity of drag gestures as an instance of the class VelocityTracker or null, if the velocity tracker has not be initialized yet

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Resets the event handler once a drag gesture has been ended.

      • isDraggingAllowed

        protected abstract boolean isDraggingAllowed()
        Returns, whether performing a drag gesture is currently allowed, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if performing a drag gesture is currently allowed, false otherwise

      • onTouchEvent

        protected abstract void onTouchEvent()
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses, when a touch event is about to be handled.

      • onDown

        protected abstract void onDown(@NonNull
                               android.view.MotionEvent event)
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to handle, when a drag gesture has been started.
        Parameters:
        event - The touch event, which started the drag gesture, as an instance of the class MotionEvent. The touch event may not be null

      • onDrag

        protected abstract void onDrag(@NonNull
                               android.view.MotionEvent event)
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to handle, when a drag gesture is performed.
        Parameters:
        event - The last touch event of the drag gesture as an instance of the class MotionEvent. The touch event may not be null

      • onUp

        protected abstract void onUp(@Nullable
                             android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Handles, when a drag gesture has been ended.
        Parameters:
        event - The touch event, which ended the drag gesture, as an instance of the class MotionEvent or null, if no fling animation should be triggered

      • isReset

        public final boolean isReset()
        Returns, whether the event handler is reset, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the event handler is reset, false otherwise

      • isDragging

        @CallSuper
public boolean isDragging()
        Returns, whether a drag gesture is currently handled by the event handler, or not. This method may be overridden by subclasses, if multiple drag helpers are used.
        Returns:
        True, if a drag gesture is currently handled by the event handler, false otherwise

      • getPriority

        public final int getPriority()
        Returns the priority of the event handler. Events are first dispatched to handlers with a higher priority.
        Returns:
        The priority of the event handler as an Integer value

      • getTouchableArea

        @Nullable
public android.graphics.RectF getTouchableArea()
        Returns the bounds of the onscreen area, the handler takes into consideration for handling touch events. Touch events that occur outside of the area are clipped. By default, the area is not restricted. Subclasses may override this method in order to restrict the area.
        Returns:
        The bounds of the onscreen area, the handler takes into consideration for handling touch events, as an instance of the class RectF or null, if the area is not restricted

      • isInsideTouchableArea

        public final boolean isInsideTouchableArea(@NonNull
                                           android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Returns, whether a specific touch event occurred inside the touchable area of the event handler.
        Parameters:
        event - The touch event, which should be checked, as an instance of the class MotionEvent. The touch event may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the given touch event occurred inside the touchable area, false otherwise

      • getDragHelper

        @NonNull
public final de.mrapp.android.util.gesture.DragHelper getDragHelper()
        Returns the drag helper, which is used by the event handler to recognize drag gestures.
        Returns:
        The drag helper, which is used by the event handler to recognize drag gestures, as an instance of the class DragHelper. The drag helper may not be null

      • setPointerId

        public final void setPointerId(int pointerId)
        Sets the id of the pointer, which has been used to start the current drag gesture.
        Parameters:
        pointerId - The id, which should be set, as an Integer value or -1, if no drag gesture is currently started

      • handleTouchEvent

        public final boolean handleTouchEvent(@NonNull
                                      android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Handles a specific touch event. The event is only handled, if it occurred inside the touchable area.
        Parameters:
        event - The event, which should be handled, as an instance of the class MotionEvent. The event may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the event has been handled, false otherwise
